### Wind speed reversal increase sand-dust storm risk

Despite efforts in vegetation restoration, the frequency of sand-dust storms is increasing due to stronger wind speeds.

![Stronger winds increase the sand-dust storm risk in northern China](1.png){height=500px}

Read more in this study:  
**Liu, Y.**, Xu, R., Ziegler, A. D. & Zeng, Z. Stronger winds increase the sand-dust storm risk in northern China. *Environmental Science: Atmospheres*. [https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2022/ea/d2ea00058j](https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2022/ea/d2ea00058j) (2022).

### Wind speed enhancement as the primary cause of sand-dust days increase in China

Compared with vegetation and precipitation, wind speed is the main driver of sand-dust days increase in recent years in China.

![Influence of wind speed, precipitation, and NDVI on the frequency of dust days in northern China.](2.png){height=300px}

Read more in this study:  
Jiang, X., Feng, Q., Zhou, L., **Liu, Y.** & Zeng, Z.
